translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about the One who gave a Support
The Story of the Elder Ārakkhadāyaka🔽“I had an altar made
for the Fortunate One Siddhattha,
and I gave protection
to the Great Seer, the Happy One.
Because of that special deed,
I did not see any fear or terror,
and when I was reborn anywhere,
I did not have any anxiety.
For ninety-four aeons,
the altar I had made in the past,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the altar.
In the sixth past aeon,
called Appase,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful King who rules by (the Dhamma of) the Wheel.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Ārakkhadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ārakkhadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ārakkhadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ārakkhadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽ārakkhadāyaka therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Story of the Elder Ārakkhadāyaka is the fourth.
